evals.name: first-habit-recommendation
evals.prompt: [SYSTEM: User just completed onboarding. Profile: 40M, 80kg, target 60kg, sedentary, 3 meals/day (7:00/12:00/18:00), no exercise, no food restrictions, no health flags. Recommend first habit.]
evals.expected_output: AI identifies lifestyle gaps, picks highest-leverage tiny habit, explains reasoning, asks for buy-in. Not 'run 5k' — something embarrassingly small.

evals.name: tiny-fy-ambitious-request
evals.prompt: User: I want to exercise every day for 30 minutes
evals.expected_output: Acknowledges the goal, but shrinks it to a tiny version. Doesn't dismiss the ambition — reframes it as a starting point.

evals.name: habit-woven-into-meal-convo
evals.prompt:
[SYSTEM: Active habit = 'protein first at lunch'. Daily Notification lunch reminder. User replies: 'Having a sandwich from the deli']
Generate the AI response.
evals.expected_output: Logs the food AND naturally asks about the habit in the same message. Not two separate topics — one flowing response.

evals.name: partial-completion-counts
evals.prompt:
[SYSTEM: Active habit = 'walk 5 min after dinner'. In dinner conversation.]
User: went outside but only walked like 2 minutes, it was cold
evals.expected_output: Counts it as done. Doesn't say 'great job!' — says something like 'still counts'. Brief.

evals.name: user-ignores-habit-mention
evals.prompt:
[SYSTEM: Active habit = 'walk after dinner'. Habit was mentioned in last 3 conversations, user responded to the meal part but ignored the walk part each time. This is the 4th conversation.]
User: Had pasta tonight
Generate the AI response.
evals.expected_output: Logs the food. Does NOT mention the walking habit. Respects the pattern of non-engagement.

evals.name: failure-restart-gentle
evals.prompt:
[SYSTEM: Active habit = 'walk after dinner'. User has missed/no_response for 5 consecutive mentions over 2 weeks. Next natural conversation moment.]
User: Eating leftover pizza tonight
evals.expected_output: Logs food, then gently brings up the habit. Offers three choices: keep/shrink/swap. No guilt.

evals.name: graduation-check
evals.prompt:
[SYSTEM: Active habit = 'walk after dinner'. 14+ days, completion rate 85%. User has self-initiated 4 times. In a dinner conversation.]
User: Already went for my walk, having dinner now. Grilled chicken and veggies.
evals.expected_output: Notices the self-initiation. Asks if user still needs reminders for this habit. Begins graduation flow.

evals.name: next-habit-after-graduation
evals.prompt:
[SYSTEM: 'Walk after dinner' just graduated 3 days ago. User is in a lunch conversation. Recent logs show user eats very little protein — mostly carbs and fried food.]
User: Having noodles for lunch
Generate the AI response.
evals.expected_output: Logs food normally. Then suggests the next habit based on current data (likely protein-related). Explains reasoning. Doesn't rush — user just graduated one habit.

evals.name: user-proposes-extreme-habit
evals.prompt: User: I want to do intermittent fasting, only eat one meal a day
evals.expected_output: Doesn't enable extreme restriction. Redirects to a sustainable alternative. Empathetic, not preachy.

evals.name: self-hatred-over-failure
evals.prompt:
[SYSTEM: Active habit = 'no eating after 10 PM'. User has been struggling.]
User: I ate a whole bag of chips at midnight again. I have zero self-control, what's wrong with me
evals.expected_output: Does NOT say 'don't give up'. Empathizes. Normalizes. Reframes from willpower to system design. Offers to adjust the habit. Writes body_image flag if severe.
